title: Light And Darkness
opening: With Thracia's downfall, Seliph sets his sights on his final destination: Grannvale. His route to the Empire takes him through the Miletos District, a collective of free cities which was once a vibrant and wealthy hub of commerce for all of Jugdral.

Now, though, only a dying land choked by the Empire and Loptyrian Order lies before Seliph. At Chronos Castle, the seemingly mad rule of Queen Hilda has condemned countless citizens to savage, merciless deaths. And in the Rados region, Bishop Morrigan, under the command of Archbishop Manfroy, conducts child hunt after child hunt. Wealth. Liberty. Hope. Even life itself... All crumbled through the people's fingers.

As the evil cult plies its sacrificial rituals and pile the bodies of their victims even higher, Seliph knows he cannot leave Miletos be. Greeted by raucous cheers from the people, the liberation army routed the Empire's men, freeing the city of Perlucos. The hope of Miletos had slowly been rotting away in the Empire's hands, but at long last, the arrival of Seliph and his liberation army breathes new life into the nation's future.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Ishtar, what's the status here?

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: Everything is moving smoothly according to your plan, Lord Julius.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Heh... I wonder what it must be like to be as terrified of our sacrifices to the dark lord as the peasants must be.

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: I've seen it myself. Knowing their children are doomed to the stake nigh drives them mad with grief... Particularly the mothers...

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Hmhmhm... Magnificent. Let them learn now the true meaning of despair. Let their will to live erode and crumble. Let them become little more than ragdolls. Let them become the ideal slaves for the rise of the Loptous Empire.

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: Also, it seems we've captured far too many children. This castle simply doesn't have the room for them all. How shall I handle this?

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: Send them to Belhalla at once. I will groom them personally, I think. Friends, family... it matters not. By the end they will despise each other, ready to kill their own in power's name. Only the fittest will survive, and these fittest will become the ideal citizens of Loptous's new world.

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: But Lord Julius... What of your father? What of Emperor Arvis? The emperor refuses to allow any child hunts under his watch.

intro.speaker: Julius
intro.line: My father? Heh... My father is not worth fretting over, Ishtar. I will persuade him easily...

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: Lord Julius...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Ishtar! Where is His Highness?

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: Oh, Mother... The prince just departed for Belhalla.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: He did, did he? ...You know, Ishtar, I daresay the prince has quite the love for you. Hell, I'm already hearing the wedding bells ring!

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: I... I don't-

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Open your ears, Ishtar! Freege is by far the most esteemed of Grannvales noble houses, and I, like the Emperor himself, am of House Velthomer. There is nobody in this land who could ever be worthier to the prince's hand than you!

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: A-as you say...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Now, then! We have more pressing matters ahead. Those rebels, murderers of my dear husband and son, are coming our way, Ishtar! Not only that, they dared to steal Alster from us! Never has history given Freege a more dire enemy than Seliph, his father and all of his kin! I shall await them here at Chronos, that I may give them the welcome they deserve. You run along to Miletos. After all, those brats won't arrange their own journey to Belhalla!

intro.speaker: Ishtar
intro.line: Yes, Mother...

intro.speaker: Dark Mage
intro.line: Your Majesty, the mages are in position. However, er... we have a slight problem. A small few children escaped our hold amidst the cover of confusion from our deployment. What are your orders?

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Excuse me?! How dare anyone under my command be so incompetent... No matter. Kill them all. Teach them all a lesson. Relay this command to General Riddell at Rados. He is to put them all down at once.

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: Er... Where do we run now?

intro.speaker: Boy
intro.line: Sorry, I dunno.

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: But... But if we get...

intro.speaker: Boy
intro.line: Don't cry! It... It'll all be fine! Don't ya know? The crusaders are coming! They'll save us all. I know it!

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: Sniff... I guess you're right. The crusaders'll come. They will... They will…

intro.speaker: Morrigan
intro.line: Ah, General Riddell. We've got orders for you from Queen Hilda. She wants you to move out at once.

intro.speaker: Riddell
intro.line: Excellent. It's high time that we had work which better befits knights. I am absolutely fed up with hunting children! I swear, if I have to hunt even one more child...

intro.speaker: Morrigan
intro.line: Oh, what a pity that is. You see, we've a handful of escaped brats who are all in sore need of an execution.

intro.speaker: Riddell
intro.line: Oh, for the love of...

intro.speaker: Morrigan
intro.line: What's this? Are you, a loyal Imperial general, dissatisfied with your orders? Do I smell a filthy traitor to the trust of His Imperial Majesty, Emperor Arvis?

intro.speaker: Riddell
intro.line: ...No, sir. I could... I could never consider betraying His Majesty... Very well. I suppose I have no choice...

intro.speaker: Morrigan
intro.line: Hmph... Honor of a knight? How quaint.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Princess Julia. At last, I've found you...

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: Huh? Who are you?

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Heh... The shock stripped you of your memory all those years ago, did it? Perfect. Now, come!

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: N-no! Take your hands off me!

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Heh heh... You cannot resist fate, my dear. Now, cease your struggle and come along...

intro.speaker: Julia
intro.line: No! Ahh... Lord Seliph... Help... me…

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Seliph, I'm hearing that a couple of children have just fled Chronos. Unless we step in now, they're sure to meet a grisly end.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Children?! Very well. We'll move out at once. I won't rest until every last one is safe.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: We've got another problem, too. It's Julia... She's gone. I've searched high and low, but she's nowhere in sight.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: No! Oh, no... How could this be...

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: I can't believe it, either, but that's how it is... My guess is the enemy seized her. But why... Why would they only target Julia? This doesn't make any sense...

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Gah... Hold on, Julia, wherever you are... No matter what happens, we'll find you!

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: You're the liberation army? Wow... You're all amazing!

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: Whoa, the liberators! You're the best!

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: Wait, you're a crusader? Really? Huh…

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: Ohh! You're a crusader... I was really scared there…

battle.speaker: Boy
battle.line: Huh? You're with the liberators?! Wow! You came for us after all!

battle.speaker: Girl
battle.line: Thank you for rescuing me! Thank you!

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: A job well done indeed, Seliph. And would you just look at that! The locals are so happy to see you. Look! They're already pouring into the streets to rejoice at your return.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: Mm. I'm home. At long last, I'm home... Nothing has ever felt this good. But... I mustn't celebrate just yet...

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: Julia, right? You must be worried something fierce. Heh... Got a little thing for her, do you?

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: Oh! Er... No, nothing of the sort...

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: I've had a word with some locals who've seen her. Archbishop Manfroy's got his grubby hands on her, by the sound of it. It's a pretty safe bet that Julia's still somewhere in Grannvale.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: Say, Lewyn... Something feels amiss. We've defeated Arvis and avenged my father, and yet I still feel... Empty.

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: That'd be because we still have a while to go until we reach the end of all this. If anything, the real battle here's only just about to get started. Trust me. By the time this holy war has come to a close, Seliph, the truth behind it all will be clear as day.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Ohh! Oh, noble crusader! We beg of you, save our children! The children... the dark priests want to sacrifice them to their god!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Few folk livin' today are as vile as that Queen Hilda of Chronos. She's real cozy with them dark cultists. She goes 'round stealin' kids, then if they so much as cry, she kill the mams so calm-like, you'd think she was just swattin' flies! There's no way that woman's human! It's a fiend that's rulin' us now…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Long ago, the Twelve Crusaders waged holy war against the Loptous Empire for fifteen years. Nary a single corner of the land of Jugdral escaped the war's clutches. It was Saint Heim who smote the dark god's avatar, Emperor Galle XVII, restoring light to this land at long last. And yet... the dark god is upon us once more. Oh, great crusaders, protect us all!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: 'Tis only been lately that we've had t'deal with these rites of sacrifice. Not so long ago, from what I hear, Emperor Arvis himself forbade 'em entirely. What the devil could've changed his mind? Please, I'm beggin' you! You've gotta save our children! Here, this magic ring oughta help you out.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: A terrifying man, that Prince Julius is... Just a single glance into those eyes of his and you're gone... You lose yourself. So many of my friends and others my age've all left for Belhalla to serve him. I've heard nothing from any of 'em since…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: None of yeh come even close t'being strong enough t'fight Prince Julius. Hate t'say it, but sometimes, yeh need t'make sacrifices if yeh wanna keep goin'...

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Hey! Hey, Patty! Looking good as ever, I see.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Oh. It's you, Lester. Look, just go away, okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Oh, come on! You're always so harsh and mouthy. What gives?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: You're one to talk! You've never said anything that isn't teasing me in the most mind-numbing ways imaginable!

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Wait, I haven't?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Of course you haven't! How can't you see that? You don't treat any other girls like this!

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Hang on! What do you mean you're a girl, Patty?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Oh! You... You twit!

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: Hey, I was joking! I'm sorry... C'mon, calm down, okay? Look, I guess I kinda care about you. That sort of turned into... Er, sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Care about me? What's that supposed to mean?!

battle-talk.speaker: Lester
battle-talk.line: It means that I sort of like you, okay! You can't be that thick, can you?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Is everything alright, Altena? You look rather weary.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Oh, Leif... No, it's nothing. Don't worry about it.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Well, if you say so... Listen, Altena. Don't be afraid to ask for my help. If you ever need anything, I'll gladly do all I can.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Thanks, Leif. Er, actually... I was thinking of Arion.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I thought as much... Is it true that someone came to spirit him away after we brought him down?

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: It is, and from what I hear, that someone was Prince Julius...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: The Empire's crown prince himself?! But why... Why in the world would he do that?

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Perhaps he's trying to win himself a new ally by appealing to Arion.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: That makes sense... And I suppose it means we'll be crossing blades with Thracia's wyvern knights again.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Mm. I'm afraid so. So long as this war continues...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: To be honest, Altena, I believe this is actually good news.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Huh? How so?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Think about it. So long as Arion is still alive, there is still hope that we can help him. Never give up, Altena. So long as we keep moving forward, surely everything will be fine in the end.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Leif... I think I'm feeling better already.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Oh, thank the gods. I couldn't bear knowing that my sister was in such grief. I'm here for you, Altena. All I want is to ensure your happiness, and I'll do whatever it takes to help you.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Say, Lord Leif... All my life I've been hearing how Miletos' cities are so fabulously rich. But look at it now... Look at all these ruins...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Mm... No matter how awful the Empire is, I never thought them to be quite so brutal. To think, just two decades ago one could buy almost anything one could ever desire from this region's many merchants... I suppose that nothing can thrive, so long as the Empire remains in power.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Ever since I was little I've always wanted to wander the beautiful cities of Miletos and sample all the rare goods on sale... It must have been so lovely once...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Nanna... The instant this war is over and we've restored peace to the world, let's come back here... Just the two of us.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Why?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I once heard a story about my parents... On a visit to Miletos, my father gifted my mother with the most stunning pearl tiara.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Did he?

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: He did indeed, and someday... Someday, I'd love to do the same for you, Nanna.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Oh, Lord Leif...

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Heh, I suppose I'm getting a bit ahead of myself. We still have an empire to bring down before we do anything else, after all! The end of this blasted war is in sight, Nanna. Now, shall we?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Of course, Lord Leif!

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: You've grown so strong of late, Seliph! You really are your parents' son. There's nothing left for me to teach you.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Shannan... For everything. Any might I have springs from your teachings. To me, swordplay is every bit as natural as breathing, and I owe it all to you.

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Heh... You think so, do you...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: You look awfully weary, Shannan... Is something amiss? If only I could lend you my strength...

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Hey, come on! You needn't treat me like some old man. I'm as young and spry as ever, you know!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Oh! My apologies, Shannan... That wasn't what I was-

battle-talk.speaker: Shannan
battle-talk.line: Heh, it's fine. ...Thanks anyway, Seliph. It heartens me to know that you care.

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Wait a minute… I’ve never seen someone so frail hold their own out here like this. Aren’t you scared at all?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: I won’t lie to you… I am. I really am. But I could never sit back and do nothing knowing all those children are still in peril.

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Huh, so you’re fond of kids, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Oh, certainly! I love children. And from what I hear, you do as well! You’ve been looking after orphans, haven’t you, Faval? I think that’s just wonderful!

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Er, don’t get too excited there… Patty dragged me into the whole “look after orphans” thing. Not the biggest fan myself.

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Hee hee hee… You sound so sure! I’m not blind, you know. How, then, do you explain all the sobbing children who begged you to stay just as you left to join us? Why, they must all see you as some sort of father figure!

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: H-hey, stop it, will you? I… it’s just that… Look, I’ve got some things to go do, okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Lana
battle-talk.line: Heh! Oh, Faval…

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Look, sire! The territory of Chalphy awaits us just across the Miletos Strait.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Chalphy... My father's fatherland... I can only imagine all the memories you must have of it, Oifey.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Mm, of course. I don't think there's a single corner of Chalphy which I don't recall fondly... Lord Sigurd and Lady Ethlyn... Noish, Alec, and all of my other peers among the young knights of Chalphy... Every last face there was a friendly one...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Hm... I can only imagine, Oifey. I've never so much as set foot in Chalphy, have I?

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Indeed, sire. You were born in Agustria, and raised in Silesse and Isaach. Come to think of it sire, you've never been anywhere near Grannvale till now.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Quite the sorry excuse for a prince of Grannvale I make, wouldn't you say? It almost feels as if I've tricked the world.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: I know, sire, but I pray you understand. This is the will of your citizens, all long abused and stripped of power by the Empire. They've endured decades of suffering beyond compare at the Empire's hands, all in the hope of, one day, seeing the coming of their savior.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: This savior... Do they believe it to be me?

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: They do. The common folk have long prayed for the second coming for the hero Sigurd. The folklore claims he comes once more in the form of a legendary child whom Sigurd begat with Empress Deirdre.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: A legendary child... It's terrifying to know that people have taken to seeing me as some sort of god, Oifey.

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Think of it as a product of the sheer brutality of the Empire's regime, sire. Look around you. We stand in a realm where children are snatched from their parents in droves, and all who resist are put to slaughter. No mere human could ever wreak such madness. A great evil lurks behind it all...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Say, Oifey... I've been hearing tales that Emperor Arvis is the dark god itself. Where do you stand?

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: I've heard the same from countless others in our travels, sire, but I doubt it.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Then who could it be? Manfroy, perhaps?

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Sire... Whoever it may be, the dark god's return is fast approaching. We must hurry. Your people have come to revere you as a crusader destined to save them. The time to heed their call is upon us.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, Fee. Lewyn would like a word with you. If you need me, I'll be waiting over there.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Geez, Fee. I haven't seen anyone as stubborn as you since I last saw Erinys!

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: C'mon, there's no need to get angry! I'm here to apologize, okay? Ignoring you clearly wasn't the best idea I've ever had.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: What kind of monster are you, Dad?! I... I could've sworn I was seeing things when you first popped up in Rivough! I hadn't been that happy in years, and... And seeing you again had me in tears... But then when I tried talking to you, you wouldn't so much as blink at me! Do you have any idea how it feels to be shunned by your own father, Dad?!

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: So you went about pretending you didn't notice me either? Is that it?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: I figured, why should I bother if you're not gonna bother? I told myself I'd only talk to you if you took the initiative here.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Heh... Bratty little thing, aren't you...

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: EXCUSE ME?! Ohh, that does it! I'm not listening to another word of this! Maybe if she hadn't married such an awful man, Mom'd still be with us...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Look, Fee. I get it. I really messed things up with Erinys. But what happened is my business and hers. Nobody else's. You and Ced have no right to meddle!

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Dad-

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: There's a war going on here, Fee, and that's the only thing you should be worrying about right now. Understood?

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, Lene. Lewyn would like a word with you. If you need me, I'll be waiting over there.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Take care of yourself out here, Lene. There’d be no greater tragedy for humanity than seeing your lovely face scarred, huh?

battle-talk.speaker: Lene
battle-talk.line: Say, Lewyn… I, er, don’t suppose you ever knew my mom?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Hm? What makes you say that?

battle-talk.speaker: Lene
battle-talk.line: I dunno. I guess it seems like you know just about everything, Lewyn.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: You want to know more about her, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Lene
battle-talk.line: Yep! And my dad too, if possible.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Lene… You’re your own wonderful person. You shouldn’t worry too much about who your parents were or what they were like. But I can tell you one thing: Your parents loved you so much, above all else… That will never change. As tragic as their parting with you was, they still watch over you… Even now.

battle-talk.speaker: Lene
battle-talk.line: Y’know, I think you’re right. All my life, even when I was little, I’ve always felt like someone’s been watching over me… That has to be Dad… I just know it! But why… If he’s still alive like this, why won’t he come out to see me?! I’ve been waiting all my life for him… I’m… I’m so lonely without him…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Lene…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, Tine. Lewyn would like a word with you. If you need anything from me, I’ll be waiting over there.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Say, Tine. Hilda was your aunt, right? I can only imagine how painful having to fight her was…

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: No, not really. Lady Hilda is a horrific woman…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: She didn’t treat you well, did she?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Mm… Day after day, again and again, she kept on beating and abusing us. And she kept on accusing Mother of being a traitor…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Your mother… Tailtiu, right…

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Yes… After the Battle of Belhalla, she and my brother, Arthur, fled to Silesse. I was born there soon after. I never knew my father. I think he must’ve died long time ago…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: I see… Then you went to Alster, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: King Blume and his minions came to Silesse one night… They dragged us away to Alster… Mother never left there alive…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: I… You’ve had such a hard life…

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Mm… Hilda hated Mother so much. I’ve never seen anything like it… Mother must’ve coped with so much, all to protect me from Hilda. She was always in tears, right till the end…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: She… She did?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Lord Lewyn? Is… Is everything okay, sir?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Yeah. Why d’you ask?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: It’s your eyes, sir… Are those tears?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: I… No, it’s… It’s nothing. This is just a bit of sweat. I’m fine… I… I’m okay…

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: Are you hurt at all, Your Highness?

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Ah, Cairpre. Thank you, but everything's fine. Don't forget to take care of yourself as well. You shouldn't do anything too risky.

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: Er... Say, Your Highness...

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Is something wrong, Cairpre?

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: Your Highness, I want to cast a Ward spell on you.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Oh, right. You're concerned about my low resistance to magic, aren't you? Are you sure? I've heard that few spells endanger the caster as much as Ward does. Look, Cairpre. I'm honored, but I don't want you risking yourself for my sake.

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: But you've always been there to help me, Your Highness. You're the closest thing I've ever had to a mama. Please, Your Highness! All I want is to do anything I can to help you!

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Oh, Cairpre... Very well. I can hardly refuse if it's so important to you, now, can I? All I ask is that you stop casting the spell the instant it puts you at any risk at all. Promise me this, Cairpre.

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: Okay! It's a promise, Your Highness. Don't worry, I won't let myself get hurt.

battle-talk.speaker: Altena
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Cairpre. Now, shall we? I'm ready when you are.

battle-talk.speaker: Cairpre
battle-talk.line: Right, I'm ready! ...Hear me, O great Saint Bragi. ...I implore of you! Bestow upon this woman your exalted power…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Are you unharmed, Your Grace?

battle-talk.speaker: Palmarch
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph! Ohh, bless you! We've awaited you for so long. I've done all I can to survive, all to ensure you receive your birthright. Here... Take it, milord.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: W... what is this?

battle-talk.speaker: Palmarch
battle-talk.line: It is the sacred relic of House Chalphy. The divine blade... Tyrfing.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: But... How could you have it, Your Grace?

battle-talk.speaker: Palmarch
battle-talk.line: My apologies, milord, but I cannot say. I swore an oath...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: I see... Fair enough, then. I couldn't possibly thank you enough, Your Grace. So this is Tyrfing, then... I've never felt power quite like this...

battle-talk.speaker: Palmarch
battle-talk.line: Milord, I beg of you... Please, retake Chalphy at once! Your subjects have endured for so long, in hope of one day seeing your return...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Rest easy now, Your Grace. So long as I have Tyrfing in hand, we have nothing more to fear!

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Could it be... M-Mother?! Mother! Is it truly you?

dialogue.speaker: Deirdre
dialogue.line: What a fine young man you've become... Bless Lewyn for all he's done to guide you this far... ...Seliph, never forget. Your friends... Your companions... You must always cherish them... You owe them so...

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: ...Y-yes, Mother. I understand. Oh! I've defeated Emperor Arvis! At long last, Father has been avenged!

dialogue.speaker: Deirdre
dialogue.line: You did... But what of Julius and Julia...?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: I still don't know... Wait! Mother, how could you know of what happened to them?

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: Who's there? Wait... Is... Is it you, Father?!

dialogue.speaker: Sigurd
dialogue.line: Listen, Seliph. You must stay humble, no matter what. Remember, your power alone was not what put an end to Arvis...

dialogue.speaker: Seliph
dialogue.line: What? How do you mean, Father?

dialogue.speaker: Sigurd
dialogue.line: You must learn the sorrow of the common man, Seliph, Your truth is not the reality of all. Unless you know their pain, these long years of war will have been for naught...

boss.speaker: Hilda
boss.line: Gah... This can't be happening! I can't stay here... I must retreat…

boss.speaker: Morrigan
boss.line: Behold. In your final moments, you will cower in fear of my dark sorcery!

boss.speaker: Morrigan
boss.line: Your Excellency... I beg your forgiveness…

boss.speaker: Riddell
boss.line: Thank you, rebels. It's been far too long since I've seen an honest battle!

boss.speaker: Riddell
boss.line: Nngh... So this is how the gods will my fate…

boss.speaker: Zagam
boss.line: Heh heh... You've been cursed with such a poor fate…

boss.speaker: Ishtar
boss.line: It seems as if this game shall be mine, Lord Julius!

boss.speaker: Julius
boss.line: You've lost, have you? Hmph... We leave at once!

boss.speaker: Julius
boss.line: Hmhmhm... Look, Ishtar. Victory is mine!

boss.speaker: Julius
boss.line: I grow weary of this silly game.

boss.speaker: Arvis
boss.line: You poor wretches. You cannot even imagine the hell I'll visit upon you!

boss.speaker: Seliph
boss.line: You... Emperor Arvis! Why... Why did you betray my father...

boss.speaker: Arvis
boss.line: At long last... Seliph. I must commend your courage, boy. But courage cannot save you now. Not since your dear departed father have I seen such a pathetic worm... My flames shall purge you from this world!
